sen.j: 日本海（にほんかい、またはにっぽんかい）は、西太平洋の縁海で、樺太、北海道、本州、九州、ユーラシア大陸の朝鮮民主主義人民共和国、大韓民国、ロシア連邦に囲まれている。
sen.e: The Sea of Japan is a marginal sea of the Western Pacific being surrounded by Sakhalin, Hokkaido, Honshu (the main island of Japan), Kyushu as well as the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (North Korea), the Republic of Korea and the Russian Federation in the Eurasian Continent.

The Sea of Japan is a marginal sea of the Western Pacific being surrounded by Sakhalin, Hokkaido, Honshu (the main island of Japan), Kyushu as well as the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (North Korea), the Republic of Korea and the Russian Federation in the Eurasian Continent.

The Sea of Japan is a marginal sea of the Western Pacific being surrounded by Sakhalin, Hokkaido, Honshu (the main island of Japan), Kyushu as well as the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (North Korea), the Republic of Korea and the Russian Federation in the Eurasian Continent.

sen.j: 英語ではSea of JapanまたはJapan Sea。
sen.e: In English, it is referred to as the Sea of Japan or Japan Sea.
In English, it is referred to as the Sea of Japan or Japan Sea.
In English, it is referred to as the Sea of Japan or Japan Sea.

sen.j: フランス語ではmer du Japon、ドイツ語ではJapanisches Meer、ロシア語ではЯпонское море、朝鮮語では일본해である。
sen.e: It is referred to as mer du Japon, Japanisches Meer, Японское море and일본해 in French, German, Russian and Korean, respectively.
It is referred to as mer du Japon, Japanisches Meer, Японское море and일본해 in French, German, Russian and Korean, respectively.
It is referred to as mer du Japon, Japanisches Meer, Японское море and일본해 in French, German, Russian and Korean, respectively.

sen.j: また朝鮮語を使う韓国では동해（トンヘ、東海）、北朝鮮では조선동해（チョソントンヘ、朝鮮東海）、조선해（チョソンヘ、朝鮮海）, その他동조선해（トンチョソンヘ、東朝鮮海）などとも呼ばれることがある。
sen.e: In Korean-speaking countries such as South Korea and North Korea, the Sea of Japan is also referred to as Donghae (East Sea) in the former while it is known as Joseon Donghae (Korea East Sea) or Joseonghae (Korea Sea) and, in addition, it is sometimes referred to as Don Joseaonghae (East Korea Sea).

In South Korea it is also referred to as 동해 (Donghae or East Sea) while in North Korea it is known as 조선동해(Joseon Donghae or Korea East Sea) or 조선해 (Joseonghae or Korea Sea) and some Korean people call it 동조선해 (Don Joseaonghae or East Korea Sea).
sen.cmt: ・同じ表現の繰り返しを避け、より簡潔な文章にしました。・すぐ上の表記にならい、朝鮮語を挿入しました。
sen.e: In South Korea it is also referred to as 동해 (Donghae or East Sea) while in North Korea it is known as 조선동해(Joseon Donghae or Korea East Sea) or 조선해 (Joseonghae or Korea Sea) and some Korean people call it 동조선해 (Don Joseaonghae or East Korea Sea).

sen.j: とはいえ、現在、国際連合及び国際的な海図の大半は「日本海」という表記を使用しており，国際的にそれらは一般的ではない。
sen.e: Nevertheless, the United Nations and the majority of international marine charts currently refer it to as the Sea of Japan and those Korean names mentioned in the foregoing are not common on the worldwide basis.
Nevertheless, the United Nations and the majority of international marine charts currently refer it to as the 'Sea of Japan' and those Korean names are not common worldwide.
sen.cmt: ・「」に対応する""がありませんでした。・mentioned in the foregoingと on the worldwide basisは削除、修正しより簡潔な表現にしました。
sen.e: Nevertheless, the United Nations and the majority of international marine charts currently refer it to as the 'Sea of Japan' and those Korean names are not common worldwide.

sen.j: 両国はこれは日本による植民地統治の残滓であるとして「東海」への置き換えもしくは併記を主張している。
sen.e: Both South and North Korea perceive the name, the Sea of Japan as a reminder of colonial administration by Japan whereby insisting that the naming be replaced by 'East Sea' or that it be written or printed immediately following 'East Sea.'
Both South and North Korea insist that 'Sea of Japan' be replaced by or followed by 'East Sea' because the current naming is a reminder of colonial administration by Japan.
sen.cmt: 文章全体を見直し、より簡潔にしました。
sen.e: Both South and North Korea insist that 'Sea of Japan' be replaced by or followed by 'East Sea' because the current naming is a reminder of colonial administration by Japan.

sen.j: この呼称問題の詳細については、日本海呼称問題を参照のこと。
sen.e: For details of this naming issue, see Sea of Japan Naming Dispute.
For details of this naming issue, see Sea of Japan Naming Dispute.
For details of this naming issue, see Sea of Japan Naming Dispute.

sen.j: 平均水深は1,752メートル、最も深い地点で3,742mで、表面積は978,000 平方キロメートルである。
sen.e: Its average depth is 1,752 meters, the greatest depth is 3,742 meters and the surface area is 978,000 square meters.
Its average depth is 1,752 meters, the greatest depth is 3,742 meters and the surface area is 978,000 square meters.
Its average depth is 1,752 meters, the greatest depth is 3,742 meters and the surface area is 978,000 square meters.

sen.j: 中央の大和堆（水深約400m）を挟んで主に3つの深い海盆があり北に日本海盆（水深およそ3,000m）、南西にやや浅い大和海盆、南東に対馬海盆（ともに水深およそ2500m）と呼ばれている。
sen.e: Surrounding the Yamato Bank (approximately 400 meters in water depth), there are 3 major deep basins including the Japan Basin (approximately 3,000 meters in water depth) to the north, the Yamato Basin to the southwest and the Tsushima Basin to the southeast (with the latter two being shallower at approximately 2,500 meters in water depth, respectively).

Surrounding the Yamato Bank (approximately 400 meters in water depth), there are 3 major deep basins: the Japan Basin (approximately 3,000 meters in water depth) on the north, the Yamato Basin on the southwest and the Tsushima Basin on the southeast (approximately 2,500 meters in water depth, respectively).
sen.cmt: ・主な3つの海盆はコロンを使って表す方が簡潔になると判断しました。・「to 方角」→「on 方角」・with the latter two being shallower at は原文にない内容なので削除しました。
sen.e: Surrounding the Yamato Bank (approximately 400 meters in water depth), there are 3 major deep basins: the Japan Basin (approximately 3,000 meters in water depth) on the north, the Yamato Basin on the southwest and the Tsushima Basin on the southeast (approximately 2,500 meters in water depth, respectively).

sen.j: また、富山湾沖から水深1,000mにも達する富山深海長谷が約500kmにわたって延びている。
sen.e: Off the coast of the Toyama Bay, the Toyama Deep-Sea Channel having the water depth of 1,000 meters stretches approximately 500 kilometers in length.
Off the coast of the Toyama Bay, the Toyama Deep-Sea Channel with as deep as 1,000 meters in water depth stretches approximately 500 kilometers in length.
sen.cmt: ・「にも達する」という部分の訳がありませんでした。
sen.e: Off the coast of the Toyama Bay, the Toyama Deep-Sea Channel with as deep as 1,000 meters in water depth stretches approximately 500 kilometers in length.

sen.j: 大陸棚が東部沿岸に広がっているが、西部、特に朝鮮半島沿いは非常に狭く、幅は30km程度である。
sen.e: There are continental shelves that extend along the eastern coastal line that are very narrow particularly along the coast of the Korean Peninsula being approximately 30 kilometer in width.

There are continental shelves that extend along the eastern coastal line while on the west side, they are very narrow particularly along the coast of the Korean Peninsula with approximately 30 kilometer in width.
sen.cmt: ・東西両沿岸の大陸棚について説明しているのではないかと思い、修正しました。
sen.e: There are continental shelves that extend along the eastern coastal line while on the west side, they are very narrow particularly along the coast of the Korean Peninsula with approximately 30 kilometer in width.

sen.j: 大陸と樺太の間の間宮海峡（タタール海峡）、樺太と北海道の間の宗谷海峡でオホーツク海と繋がっている。
sen.e: The Sea of Japan is connected to the Okhotsk Sea through the Mamia Strait (the Tatar Strait) between the continent and Sakhalin as well as through the Soya Strait between Sakhalin and Hokkaido.
The Sea of Japan is connected to the Okhotsk Sea through the Mamiya Strait (the Tatar Strait) between the continent and Sakhalin as well as through the Soya Strait between Sakhalin and Hokkaido.
The Sea of Japan is connected to the Okhotsk Sea through the Mamiya Strait (the Tatar Strait) between the continent and Sakhalin as well as through the Soya Strait between Sakhalin and Hokkaido.

sen.j: また、北海道と本州の間の津軽海峡では太平洋と、九州と対馬島の間の対馬海峡東水道、対馬島と韓国の間の朝鮮海峡で東シナ海と繋がっている。
sen.e: The Sea of Japan is also connected to the Pacific Ocean through the Tsugaru Strait between Hokkaido and Honshu while it is connected to the East China Sea through the Tsushima Strait between Kyushu and Tsushima Island as well as through the Korea Strait between Tsushima Island and South Korea.

The Sea of Japan is also connected to the Pacific Ocean through the Tsugaru Strait between Hokkaido and Honshu while it is connected to the East China Sea through the Eastern Channel of the Tsushima Strait between Kyushu and Tsushima Island as well as through the Korea Strait between Tsushima Island and South Korea.
sen.cmt: ・「対馬海峡東水道」の英訳を修正しました。
sen.e: The Sea of Japan is also connected to the Pacific Ocean through the Tsugaru Strait between Hokkaido and Honshu while it is connected to the East China Sea through the Eastern Channel of the Tsushima Strait between Kyushu and Tsushima Island as well as through the Korea Strait between Tsushima Island and South Korea.

sen.j: 海峡の水深が浅いため外海との海水の交換は少なく、唯一対馬海峡から対馬海流が流入するのみである。
sen.e: Since the straits have shallow water depth, there is little exchange of sea water with open seas except for the Tsushima Current flowing in from the Tsushima Current.
Since the straits have shallow water depth, there is little exchange of sea water with open seas except for the Tsushima Current from the Tsushima Strait flowing in.
sen.cmt: ・「対馬海峡」の英訳を修正しました。
sen.e: Since the straits have shallow water depth, there is little exchange of sea water with open seas except for the Tsushima Current from the Tsushima Strait flowing in.

sen.j: 暖流の流入は日本の温暖な気候に影響を与えている。
sen.e: Influxes of warm currents have influence of the temperate climate of Japan.
Influxes of warm currents have influence of the temperate climate of Japan.
Influxes of warm currents have influence of the temperate climate of Japan.

sen.j: 北部には寒流のリマン海流が流れているが、地質調査からかつて親潮が流れていた事が明かとなった。
sen.e: There is the Liman Cold Current flowing on the north but, as a result of a geological survey, it has come to light that the Oyashio Current was once running in that area.
There is the Liman Cold Current flowing on the north but, as a result of a geological survey, it has come to light that the the Oyashio current (the Kuril current) was once running in that area.
sen.cmt: ・「親潮」は用語集の用語検索でthe Oyashio current (the Kuril current)となっていました。
sen.e: There is the Liman Cold Current flowing on the north but, as a result of a geological survey, it has come to light that the the Oyashio current (the Kuril current) was once running in that area.

sen.j: 深層には太平洋とは全く性質を異にする日本海固有水と呼ばれる、寒冷で溶存酸素量に富んだ海水が分布する。
sen.e: In the deep layer, the cold and dissolved oxygen-rich sea water which is referred to as the Proper Water in the Japan Sea having totally different properties from that of the Pacific Ocean is found.
In the deep layer, there is the cold and dissolved oxygen-rich sea water called the Proper Water in the Japan Sea which has totally different properties from that of the Pacific Ocean.
sen.cmt: ・主語と動詞の位置が離れすぎていたので近づけました。
sen.e: In the deep layer, there is the cold and dissolved oxygen-rich sea water called the Proper Water in the Japan Sea which has totally different properties from that of the Pacific Ocean.

sen.j: 北方と南西海域は豊富な水産資源が得られ、鉱物資源や天然ガス、わずかながら石油そしてメタンハイドレートの存在など経済的にも重要な海域とされる。
sen.e: On the north and southwest, the coastal water body is rich with marine resources and, with minerals, natural gas as well as small amount of petroleum and methane hydrate being found, it is considered to have economical significance.

The areas on the north and southwest are rich with marine resources and it is considered economically important because minerals, natural gas as well as small amount of petroleum and methane hydrate are also available.
sen.cmt: ・「海域」をareaとした方が、この文章では自然だと思われたので修正し、それに合わせて文章も直しました。
sen.e: The areas on the north and southwest are rich with marine resources and it is considered economically important because minerals, natural gas as well as small amount of petroleum and methane hydrate are also available.

sen.j: 日本列島は4000万年前まで大陸の一部であったが、4000万年前頃から2000万年前にかけて大陸から分離した。
sen.e: Up to 40 million years ago, the Japanese archipelago was part of the Asian Continent but it became detached from the continent approximately between 40 million and 20 million years ago.
Up to 40 million years ago, the Japanese archipelago was part of the Asian Continent but it became detached from the continent approximately between 40 million and 20 million years ago.
Up to 40 million years ago, the Japanese archipelago was part of the Asian Continent but it became detached from the continent approximately between 40 million and 20 million years ago.

sen.j: これによって日本海の原型が形成され、その後拡大が進み数百万年前にはほぼ現在の配置になった。
sen.e: At that time, the ancestor of the Sea of Japan was hereby formed which subsequently proceeded to expand to settle into approximately the current configuration several million years ago.
Because of this, the original form of the Sea of Japan was created and after expanding, it was arranged into approximately the current layout several million years ago.
sen.cmt: ・「これによって」にあたる表現がありませんでした。・ancestor、configurationがこの文では自然ではないと思われたので修正しました。
sen.e: Because of this, the original form of the Sea of Japan was created and after expanding, it was arranged into approximately the current layout several million years ago.

sen.j: 対馬海峡はまだユーラシア大陸と陸続きで、対馬海峡が形成されたのは第四紀になってからと言われている。
sen.e: The Tsushima Strait was still part of the Eurasian Continent then and it is said that it was during the fourth century when that strait was formed.
The Tsushima Strait was still part of the Eurasian Continent then and it is said that the strait was formed during Quaternary period.
sen.cmt: ・itが主節にも従属節にも使われていたので、分かりやすさの点から修正しました。・「第四期」が「四世紀」という意味になっていたので修正しました。
sen.e: The Tsushima Strait was still part of the Eurasian Continent then and it is said that the strait was formed during Quaternary period.

sen.j: その後氷期の世界的な海水準変動によって、水深130m程度の浅い海峡は閉じたり開いたりを繰り返していた。
sen.e: Later on, due to the current sea level rise that occurred worldwide during the glacial period, the strait having shallow water depth of approximately 130 meters kept alternating between opening and closing.
Later on, due to the current sea level rise that occurred worldwide during the glacial period, the strait having shallow water depth of approximately 130 meters kept opening and closing.
sen.cmt: ・「閉じたり開いたりを繰り返し…」の部分はもっと簡潔にできると思い修正しました。
sen.e: Later on, due to the current sea level rise that occurred worldwide during the glacial period, the strait having shallow water depth of approximately 130 meters kept opening and closing.

sen.j: その為、堆積物の岩相や同位体の構成比、元素濃度は劇的に変化をしている。
sen.e: As a result, sediment lithofacies and isotopic composition ratios and element concentrations have gone through dramatic changes.
As a result, sediment lithofacies, isotopic composition ratios and element concentrations have gone through dramatic changes.
As a result, sediment lithofacies, isotopic composition ratios and element concentrations have gone through dramatic changes.

sen.j: サハリンから日本列島沿岸に沿って海嶺やマグニチュード7クラスの地震の多発域が帯状に連なっており、これを日本海東縁変動帯と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Between Sakhalin and the coastline of the Japanese archipelago, there is a band of areas where the magnitude 7 class earthquakes frequently occur that is referred to as the Japan Sea Eastern Margin Mobile Belt.

Between Sakhalin and the coastline of the Japanese archipelago, there is a band of areas where the magnitude 7 class earthquakes frequently occur that is referred to as the Japan Sea Eastern Margin Mobile Belt.

Between Sakhalin and the coastline of the Japanese archipelago, there is a band of areas where the magnitude 7 class earthquakes frequently occur that is referred to as the Japan Sea Eastern Margin Mobile Belt.

sen.j: 日本海東縁変動帯では、,ネフチェゴルスク地震、北海道南西沖地震、日本海中部地震‎、庄内沖地震、新潟地震、新潟県中越地震、新潟県中越沖地震などが発生している。
sen.e: Various earthquakes including the Neftegorsk earthquake, South-West off Hokkaido earthquake, Middle Japan Sea earthquake, Shonai earthquake, Niigata earthquake, Niigata Chuetsu earthquake and Niigataken Chuetsu-oki Earthquake in 2007 were generated in the Japan Sea Eastern Margin Mobile Belt.

There were various earthquakes in the Japan Sea Eastern Margin Mobile Belt so far including the Neftegorsk earthquake, the South-West off Hokkaido earthquake, Middle Japan Sea earthquake, Shonai earthquake, Niigata earthquake, Niigata Chuetsu earthquake and the Niigataken Chuetsu-oki Earthquake in 2007.
sen.cmt: ・主語と述語の位置を近づけました。
sen.e: There were various earthquakes in the Japan Sea Eastern Margin Mobile Belt so far including the Neftegorsk earthquake, the South-West off Hokkaido earthquake, Middle Japan Sea earthquake, Shonai earthquake, Niigata earthquake, Niigata Chuetsu earthquake and the Niigataken Chuetsu-oki Earthquake in 2007.

sen.j: 漂着物として、主に韓国、中国など日本海を航行する貨物船や漁船、また朝鮮半島や日本本土から不法投棄されるゴミが海流にのって、対馬や日本海沿岸に漂着する。
sen.e: With regard to wreckage, refuse which has been illegally disposed of mainly by Korean and Chinese freight ships and fishing boats sailing the Sea of Japan, the Korean Peninsula and Japanese mainland moves with the sea current and drifts ashore along the coast of Tsushima and the Sea of Japan.

With regard to wreckage, many kinds of waste materials which have been illegally disposed of mainly by Korean and Chinese freight ships and fishing boats sailing the Sea of Japan as well as from the Korean Peninsula and Japanese mainland moves with the sea current and drifts ashore along the coast of Tsushima and the Sea of Japan.
sen.cmt: ・refuteは「ごみ」という意味もあるようですが、分かりやすさからwaste materialsに修正しました。
sen.e: With regard to wreckage, many kinds of waste materials which have been illegally disposed of mainly by Korean and Chinese freight ships and fishing boats sailing the Sea of Japan as well as from the Korean Peninsula and Japanese mainland moves with the sea current and drifts ashore along the coast of Tsushima and the Sea of Japan.

sen.j: その量は膨大で沿岸地方自治体の財政を圧迫するほどである。
sen.e: The volume of wreckage is so massive that it puts finance of the municipalities in coastal regions under stress.
The volume of wreckage is so massive that it places an enormous financial burden on the municipalities in coastal regions.
sen.cmt: ・「財政を圧迫する」は辞書（英辞郎）の表現を参考に修正しました。
sen.e: The volume of wreckage is so massive that it places an enormous financial burden on the municipalities in coastal regions.

sen.j: さらに、ロシアなどが遺棄していた放射性物質は深海を汚染しているおそれが大きく、カニや深海魚の汚染に不安感がもたれている。
sen.e: Additionally, there is the possibility that radioactive materials abandoned by some countries including Russia have polluted deep waters whereby there is a concern about contamination of crabs and deep-sea fish.

Additionally, there is the possibility that radioactive materials abandoned by some countries including Russia have polluted deep waters whereby there is a concern about contamination of crabs and deep-sea fish.

Additionally, there is the possibility that radioactive materials abandoned by some countries including Russia have polluted deep waters whereby there is a concern about contamination of crabs and deep-sea fish.

sen.j: 特に経済が悪化していた当時のロシアでは太平洋艦隊 (ロシア海軍)の古い原子力潜水艦の原子炉を日本海公海上の海溝に投棄していたことが問題とされている。
sen.e: Russia in the midst of economic deterioration in those days was discarding nuclear power reactors of the old nuclear submarines of the Pacific fleet (Russian Navy) in the ocean trench over international waters of the Sea of Japan which is considered to be particularly problematic.

Russia in the midst of economic deterioration in those days was discarding nuclear power reactors of the old nuclear submarines of the Pacific fleet (Russian Navy) in the ocean trench over international waters of the Sea of Japan which is considered to be particularly problematic.

Russia in the midst of economic deterioration in those days was discarding nuclear power reactors of the old nuclear submarines of the Pacific fleet (Russian Navy) in the ocean trench over international waters of the Sea of Japan which is considered to be particularly problematic.

sen.j: また、冬季の天候の悪化時に起きる海難事故では、ナホトカ号重油流出事故のように大量の重油で沿岸部を汚染する事件が多発している。
sen.e: Additionally, due to bad weather in the winter months, there have been many marine accidents including the Nakhodka oil spill accident which polluted the coastline with a large amount of crude oil.
Additionally, due to bad weather in the winter months, there have been many marine accidents including the Nakhodka oil spill accident which polluted the coastline with a large amount of crude oil.
Additionally, due to bad weather in the winter months, there have been many marine accidents including the Nakhodka oil spill accident which polluted the coastline with a large amount of crude oil.

sen.j: 中国、ロシア、韓国船の中には船内を海水で洗浄した廃油を海に投棄する船が後をたたない。
sen.e: There is no end of dumping waste oil in the ocean by some of the Chinese, Russian and Korean ships after cleaning inside those ships with seawater.
There is no end of dumping waste oil in the ocean by some of the Chinese, Russian and Korean ships after cleaning inside those ships with seawater.
There is no end of dumping waste oil in the ocean by some of the Chinese, Russian and Korean ships after cleaning inside those ships with seawater.

sen.j: 主に冬から春にかけて、航行中の船から材木などが大量に流出し航行に危険をもたらす事件もおこっている。
sen.e: Mostly between winter and spring, there have been some accidents in which large quantities of lumber or the like was spilled from ships underway creating hazardous conditions for navigation.
Mostly between winter and spring, there have been some accidents posing a risk to navigation in which large quantities of lumber or the like were spilled from ships underway.
sen.cmt: ・「航行に危険をもたらす事件」の表現を前に出した方がより読みやすくなるのではと考えました。
sen.e: Mostly between winter and spring, there have been some accidents posing a risk to navigation in which large quantities of lumber or the like were spilled from ships underway.

sen.j: 沿岸部の岩礁地帯の植物が死滅して、焼いたサザエの殻のように、水面下の岩についた貝等の屍骸で磯全体が広範囲にわたって白く焼けたように見えることから、この呼び名がある。
sen.e: When vegetations are wiped out in the rocky areas along the shore, a wide area of rocky shore will look ash white as roasted turban shell and, hence, this term 'isoyake' which means 'burnt shores.'
When vegetations are wiped out in the rocky areas along the shore, a wide area of rocky shore will look ash white as roasted turban shell and, hence, this term 'isoyake' which means 'shore-burning.'
sen.cmt: ・「磯やけ」にあたる部分はタイトルと同じ表現にしました。
sen.e: When vegetations are wiped out in the rocky areas along the shore, a wide area of rocky shore will look ash white as roasted turban shell and, hence, this term 'isoyake' which means 'shore-burning.'

sen.j: 日本海沿岸部全体で観察される現象で、沿岸部での魚の激減、えさの減少から沿岸部で産卵されて育つ人間に有用な魚の稚魚の成長が難しくなることなど、漁業全体への深刻な影響が懸念される。
sen.e: It is a phenomenon seen in all of the Sea of Japan coastal areas which causes a concern over a serious impact on the entire fishing industry, with problems including that the fish population is drastically reduced and that, due to the decreased food, the growth of juvenile fish of those species valuable to human that are spawned and grow in the coastal areas will be challenged.

It is a phenomenon seen in all of the Sea of Japan coastal areas which causes a concern over a serious impact on the entire fishing industry, with problems including that the fish population is drastically reduced and that, due to the decreased food, the growth of juvenile fish of those species valuable to human that are spawned and grow in the coastal areas will be challenged.

It is a phenomenon seen in all of the Sea of Japan coastal areas which causes a concern over a serious impact on the entire fishing industry, with problems including that the fish population is drastically reduced and that, due to the decreased food, the growth of juvenile fish of those species valuable to human that are spawned and grow in the coastal areas will be challenged.

sen.j: 川の水が流入する直近の場所では少ないことから、海水の変化が原因と考えられている。
sen.e: Due to the fact that shore-burning is uncommon around the immediate areas where river waters flow in, it is considered to be caused by change in seawater.
Due to the fact that shore-burning is uncommon around the immediate areas where river waters flow in, it is considered to be caused by change in seawater.
Due to the fact that shore-burning is uncommon around the immediate areas where river waters flow in, it is considered to be caused by change in seawater.

sen.j: 海水の変化の理由として、有力な説は船底塗料等の中に含まれる環境ホルモンによる海洋汚染、流入する河川の治水による有機物の減少があげられている。
sen.e: Considering the factors for change in seawater, there are various opinions including the marine pollution caused by endocrine disrupters contained in ship bottom paint which is the strongest argument and the reduced organic matter due to the flood control measures installed for inflowing rivers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 栄養減化現象 －定訳不明
sen.e: According to the widely-accepted opinions over the change in seawater, it results from the marine pollution caused by endocrine disrupters contained in ship bottom paint or the reduced organic matter due to the flood control measures installed for inflowing rivers.
sen.cmt: ・「海水の変化の有力な理由によると…」と解釈しなおし、文章全体を簡潔にしました。
sen.e: According to the widely-accepted opinions over the change in seawater, it results from the marine pollution caused by endocrine disrupters contained in ship bottom paint or the reduced organic matter due to the flood control measures installed for inflowing rivers.

sen.j: 最新の説には、温暖化による海水の有機物の減少（貧栄養化現象、栄養減化現象）をあげる説等があるが、原因は不明である。
sen.e: The latest opinion is that the reduced organic matter due to the warm temperature trend in seawater (to cause oligotrophication and reduced nutrients) but the cause remains unknown.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As one of the latest opinion, the reduced organic matters in seawater due to global warming (oligotrophication and reduced nutrients) is pointed out, but the cause remains unknown.
sen.cmt: ・訳文には「～説等」にあたる部分がなかったので、それを表すために修正しました。
sen.e: As one of the latest opinion, the reduced organic matters in seawater due to global warming (oligotrophication and reduced nutrients) is pointed out, but the cause remains unknown.

sen.j: なお、現代の磯を見慣れている人には「磯焼け」が常態であるのでこの言葉に実感はないが、半世紀前の人々が普通に見た磯（水中）は、岩などが見えないほど海草が生い茂っていたのである。
sen.e: As, for those who are used to seeing rocky shores of the present-day, the state of 'shore-burning' is the normal condition, it may be difficult to appreciate the meaning of that term but, half a century ago, the part of rocky shores under water which people commonly saw were so densely covered with marine plants that rocks were not visible.

Although 'shore-burning' is the normal condition for those who are used to seeing the present rocky shores and they can not get a real sense of that term, half a century ago, people commonly saw rocky shores under water which were so densely covered with marine plants that rocks were not visible.
sen.cmt: ・冒頭にあるAsがわかりにくかったので書き換えました。
sen.e: Although 'shore-burning' is the normal condition for those who are used to seeing the present rocky shores and they can not get a real sense of that term, half a century ago, people commonly saw rocky shores under water which were so densely covered with marine plants that rocks were not visible.

sen.j: 太平洋より種族数が少なく固有種も乏しいことから、日本海の形成時代はあまり古くないといわれている。
sen.e: Due to the fact that there are smaller numbers of breeds and fewer indigenous species comparing to that found in the Pacific Ocean, it is said that the formation of Nihonkai occurred not too long ago.

Due to the fact that there are smaller numbers of breeds and fewer indigenous species comparing to that found in the Pacific Ocean, it is said that the formation of the Sea of Japan occurred not too long ago.
sen.cmt: ・「日本海」の表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Due to the fact that there are smaller numbers of breeds and fewer indigenous species comparing to that found in the Pacific Ocean, it is said that the formation of the Sea of Japan occurred not too long ago.

sen.j: カニなどの沿岸性底動物は一般に豊富で、能登半島を境にしてその動物相にやや変化がみられる。
sen.e: There are generally an abundance of bottom-dwelling sea animals found along the coast such as crabs and slight difference is noted in fish fauna from one side of the Noto Peninsula to another.
There are generally an abundance of costal-zone bottom animals such as crabs and slight difference is noted in fish fauna from one side of the Noto Peninsula to another.
sen.cmt: ・用語集の用語検索を参考に「沿岸性底動物」を修正しました。
sen.e: There are generally an abundance of costal-zone bottom animals such as crabs and slight difference is noted in fish fauna from one side of the Noto Peninsula to another.

sen.j: 太平洋岸に比べ、対馬暖流の影響で南方系種族の北限がはるか北方にのびている。
sen.e: Comparing to the Pacific Ocean, the northern most range for southern species extends too far north due to the effect of warm current of the Tsushima Strait.
Comparing to the Pacific Ocean, the northern most range for southern species extends far north due to the effect of warm current of the Tsushima Strait.
sen.cmt: ・「遥か北方」はfar northだけで表現できるのではと判断しました。
sen.e: Comparing to the Pacific Ocean, the northern most range for southern species extends far north due to the effect of warm current of the Tsushima Strait.

sen.j: 例を挙げると、サザエは日本海側では青森県でも漁獲されるのに対し太平洋側では関東地方以北には現れない。
sen.e: For instance, turban shells are harvested in Aomori Prefecture on Nihonkai, whereas, they are not found in areas north of the Kanto region on the Pacific Ocean.
For instance, turban shells are harvested even in Aomori Prefecture on the side of the Sea of Japan, whereas, they are not found in areas north of the Kanto region on the side of the Pacific Ocean.
sen.cmt: ・「～でも」、「～側」の表現がなかったので補足しました。
sen.e: For instance, turban shells are harvested even in Aomori Prefecture on the side of the Sea of Japan, whereas, they are not found in areas north of the Kanto region on the side of the Pacific Ocean.

sen.j: プランクトンは沿海沖の冷水域および陸棚上に多く、中央部に乏しい。
sen.e: There are an abundance of plankton in areas where water is cold and on continental shelf off the coast, whereas, very small amount of same exist in the central region.
There are an abundance of plankton in areas where water is cold and on continental shelf off the coast, whereas, very small amount in the central region.
sen.cmt: ・of same exist はない方が簡潔では、と思い削除しました。
sen.e: There are an abundance of plankton in areas where water is cold and on continental shelf off the coast, whereas, very small amount in the central region.

sen.j: 種類は対馬暖流系の暖水種と、リマン寒流系の冷水種に分けられるが、両者の分布は水塊分布ほど明確に区分されず、混在海域が広い。
sen.e: The type of plankton is broken down into warm water species in the Tushima Warm Current and cold water species in the Liman Cold Current but the distribution of these types is not as clearly defined as water mass distribution and there is a wide sea area where they coexist.

The type of plankton is broken down into warm water species in the Tushima Warm Current and cold water species in the Liman Cold Current, but the distribution of both types is not as clearly divided as water mass distribution and there is a wide sea area where they coexist.
sen.cmt: ・「両者」はbothの方が、「区分」はdivideの方がこの文では適切ではないかと思い修正しました。
sen.e: The type of plankton is broken down into warm water species in the Tushima Warm Current and cold water species in the Liman Cold Current, but the distribution of both types is not as clearly divided as water mass distribution and there is a wide sea area where they coexist.

sen.j: 北方系の魚類としては、ニシン、サケ、マス、タラなどがあり、南方系の魚類としてはやや温帯性に属するブリが多いが、代表的な暖水魚であるカツオ、マグロなどはほとんど漁獲されない。
sen.e: The northern hemisphere fish include herring, salmon, trout and cod, whereas, among the southern hemisphere fish, there is a large number of yellow tail that somewhat belongs to the temperate zone fish variety but the representative warm water fish such as bonito and tuna are hardly ever caught.

The northern hemisphere fish include herring, salmon, trout and cod, whereas, among the southern hemisphere fish, there are a large number of yellow tails that somewhat belongs to the temperate zone fish variety but the representative warm water fish such as bonito and tuna are hardly ever caught.
sen.cmt: ・「…ブリが多い」の部分を複数形の表現に直しました。
sen.e: The northern hemisphere fish include herring, salmon, trout and cod, whereas, among the southern hemisphere fish, there are a large number of yellow tails that somewhat belongs to the temperate zone fish variety but the representative warm water fish such as bonito and tuna are hardly ever caught.

sen.j: 魚類としてもっと重要なものは温帯性のマダイ、マイワシ、サバ、カレイなどである。
sen.e: Those living in the temperate zone such as red sea bream, true sardines, mackerel and flatfish are more important as fish.
Those living in the temperate zone such as red sea bream, true sardines, mackerel and flatfish are more important as fish.
Those living in the temperate zone such as red sea bream, true sardines, mackerel and flatfish are more important as fish.

sen.j: これらの分布を太平洋と比較すると、次のような特徴がある。
sen.e: Comparing the distribution of these fish species to that for the Pacific Ocean, there are the following characteristics:
Comparing the distribution of these fish species to that for the Pacific Ocean, there are the following characteristics:
Comparing the distribution of these fish species to that for the Pacific Ocean, there are the following characteristics:

sen.j: 南方系魚類の回遊範囲は太平洋岸より北上し、北方系魚類の境界ははるかに南下している。
sen.e: The recurrent migration range of the southern hemisphere fish includes the north of the Pacific Ocean coastline, whereas, the boundary for the northern hemisphere fish is far down south of that point.

The recurrent migration range of the southern hemisphere fish includes the north of the Pacific Ocean coastline, whereas, the boundary for the northern hemisphere fish is far down south of that point.

The recurrent migration range of the southern hemisphere fish includes the north of the Pacific Ocean coastline, whereas, the boundary for the northern hemisphere fish is far down south of that point.

sen.j: カツオ、マグロが少ないので、日本海中央のサバ延縄漁業以外に遠洋漁業が発達しない。
sen.e: Due to the fact that there are not many bonito or tuna, deep-sea fishing except for mackerel longline fishing in the central area of the Sea of Japan has not developed.
Due to the fact that there are not many bonito or tuna, deep-sea fishing except for mackerel longline fishing in the central area of the Sea of Japan has not developed.
Due to the fact that there are not many bonito or tuna, deep-sea fishing except for mackerel longline fishing in the central area of the Sea of Japan has not developed.

sen.j: 表層水は夏に高温になるが、わずか下層では寒冷となるため、表層でイワシ、サバ、鯛など温暖水魚がとれ、深海や海底ではタチウオ、タラなどの冷水魚がとれる。
sen.e: Surface water becomes warm in the summer but lower layer water just below the surface remains cold whereby warm water fish such as sardine, mackerel and sea bream is caught in the area close to the surface while cold water fish such as cutlass fish and cod is caught in deep waters and ocean floor.

Surface water becomes warm in the summer but lower layer water just below the surface remains cold whereby warm water fish such as sardine, mackerel and sea bream is caught in the area close to the surface while cold water fish such as cutlass fish and cod is caught in deep waters and on ocean floor.

Surface water becomes warm in the summer but lower layer water just below the surface remains cold whereby warm water fish such as sardine, mackerel and sea bream is caught in the area close to the surface while cold water fish such as cutlass fish and cod is caught in deep waters and on ocean floor.

sen.j: また古来からクジラの回遊経路として知られ、かつて沿岸には多数の捕鯨漁村が存在した。
sen.e: It has been also known as the migratory route of whales since ancient times and numerous whale fishing villages used to b found along the coast.
It has been also known as the migratory route of whales since ancient times and numerous whale fishing villages used to be found along the coast.
It has been also known as the migratory route of whales since ancient times and numerous whale fishing villages used to be found along the coast.

sen.j: これらのほとんどは捕鯨により激減したため今では稀にしか見られないが、現在でも多数のイルカ類や、少数だがヒゲクジラでは珍しく大規模な回遊を行わないミンククジラやナガスクジラの個体群も存在する。
sen.e: As the number of whales has been sharply decreased due to whaling, whale sightings are very rare these days but many delphinoid species and, among baleen whale species, small population of minke whales and fin whales that do not take on extensive migrations remain in existence today.

As the number of whales has been sharply decreased due to whaling, whale sightings are very rare these days but many delphinoid species and, among baleen whale species, small population of minke whales and fin whales that do not take on extensive migrations remain in existence today.

As the number of whales has been sharply decreased due to whaling, whale sightings are very rare these days but many delphinoid species and, among baleen whale species, small population of minke whales and fin whales that do not take on extensive migrations remain in existence today.

sen.j: 天橋立、鳥取砂丘、千里浜海岸、丹後の鳴き砂など海と砂の作る不思議な海岸の光景が有名である。
sen.e: The magical views created by the sea and sands such as Amanohashidate, Tottori-sakyu Sand Dunes, Senrigahama Beach and Tango no Nakizuna are well known.
The magical views created by the sea and sands such as Amanohashidate, Tottori-sakyu Sand Dunes, Senrigahama Beach and Tango no Nakisuna are well known.
sen.cmt: ・「鳴き砂」は「なきすな」と読むそうです。
sen.e: The magical views created by the sea and sands such as Amanohashidate, Tottori-sakyu Sand Dunes, Senrigahama Beach and Tango no Nakisuna are well known.

sen.j: また、多くの風光明媚な観光地や天然記念物が散在し、北海道から対馬まで、観光資源としての価値もたかい。
sen.e: Additionally, there are numerous scenic spots noted for their superb views and national monuments that scatter along the coastlines of Nihonkai from Hokkaido offering valuable tourist attractions.
Additionally, numerous scenic spots and national monuments scatter in areas along the Sea of Japan and the coastlines from Hokkaido to Tsushima offer valuable tourist attractions.
sen.cmt: ・「風光明媚な」はscenicで伝わるのでnoted for their superb viewsは削除しました。・「対馬まで」の訳が抜けていました。
sen.e: Additionally, numerous scenic spots and national monuments scatter in areas along the Sea of Japan and the coastlines from Hokkaido to Tsushima offer valuable tourist attractions.

sen.j: 日本海に面した地域を指定した国立公園には利尻礼文サロベツ国立公園、山陰海岸国立公園、大山隠岐国立公園の3公園がある。
sen.e: The coastal areas of the Sea of Japan that have been designated as the national parks include the following three: the Rishiri-Rebun-Sarobetsu National Park, Sanin-Kaigan National Park and Daisen-Oki National Park.

The coastal areas of the Sea of Japan that have been designated as the national parks include the following three: the Rishiri-Rebun-Sarobetsu National Park, Sanin-Kaigan National Park and Daisen-Oki National Park.

The coastal areas of the Sea of Japan that have been designated as the national parks include the following three: the Rishiri-Rebun-Sarobetsu National Park, Sanin-Kaigan National Park and Daisen-Oki National Park.

sen.j: 暑寒別天売焼尻国定公園、ニセコ積丹小樽海岸国定公園、津軽国定公園、男鹿国定公園、鳥海国定公園、佐渡弥彦米山国定公園、能登半島国定公園、越前加賀海岸国定公園、若狭湾国定公園、北長門海岸国定公園、玄海国定公園、壱岐対馬国定公園など多くの地が国定公園の指定を受けているが、近時、道路港湾によりその風景は破壊されつつある。
sen.e: There are numerous areas along the Sea of Japan coastline that have been designated as quasi-national parks including the Shokanbetsu-Teuri-Yagishiri Quasi-National Park, Niseko-Shakotan-Otaru Kaigan Quasi-National Park, Tsugaru Quasi-National Park, Oga Quasi-National Park, Chokai Quasi-National Park, Sado-Yahiko-Yoneyana Quasi-National Park, Noto Peninsula Quasi-National Park, Echizen Kaga Coast Quasi-National Park, Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park, Kitanagato Beach Quasi-National Park, Genkai Quasi-National Park and Iki-Tsushima Quasi-National Park but, due to the constructions of roads, ports and harbors in recent years, their landscapes are in the process of being brought to destruction.

There are numerous areas along the Sea of Japan coastline that have been designated as quasi-national parks including the Shokanbetsu-Teuri-Yagishiri Quasi-National Park, Niseko-Shakotan-Otaru Kaigan Quasi-National Park, Tsugaru Quasi-National Park, Oga Quasi-National Park, Chokai Quasi-National Park, Sado-Yahiko-Yoneyana Quasi-National Park, Noto Peninsula Quasi-National Park, Echizen Kaga Coast Quasi-National Park, Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park, Kitanagato Beach Quasi-National Park, Genkai Quasi-National Park and Iki-Tsushima Quasi-National Park but recently, constructions of roads, ports and harbors are damaging those landscapes.
sen.cmt: ・「破壊されつつある」の表現を「道路港湾」を主語にして簡潔にしました。
sen.e: There are numerous areas along the Sea of Japan coastline that have been designated as quasi-national parks including the Shokanbetsu-Teuri-Yagishiri Quasi-National Park, Niseko-Shakotan-Otaru Kaigan Quasi-National Park, Tsugaru Quasi-National Park, Oga Quasi-National Park, Chokai Quasi-National Park, Sado-Yahiko-Yoneyana Quasi-National Park, Noto Peninsula Quasi-National Park, Echizen Kaga Coast Quasi-National Park, Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park, Kitanagato Beach Quasi-National Park, Genkai Quasi-National Park and Iki-Tsushima Quasi-National Park but recently, constructions of roads, ports and harbors are damaging those landscapes.

sen.j: 多数のフェリー航路が設定されている。
sen.e: There are numerous ferry routes in effect in the Sea of Japan.
There are numerous ferry routes in the Sea of Japan.
sen.cmt: ・in effectはなくても問題ないと思います。
sen.e: There are numerous ferry routes in the Sea of Japan.

sen.j: 東日本フェリー （室蘭 - 直江津 - 博多）※休航中

sen.j: また、上海市から北アメリカへの航路は日本海から津軽海峡を経て太平洋に抜けるのが夏場は普通である。
sen.e: Additionally, during the summer, the sea routes between Shanghai City and North America usually start in the Sea of Japan proceeding to the Pacific Ocean via the Tsugaru Strait.
Additionally, during the summer, the sea routes between Shanghai City and North America usually start in the Sea of Japan proceeding to the Pacific Ocean via the Tsugaru Strait.
Additionally, during the summer, the sea routes between Shanghai City and North America usually start in the Sea of Japan proceeding to the Pacific Ocean via the Tsugaru Strait.

sen.j: 南西部にあり大韓民国が占領している竹島 (島根県)（朝鮮名「独島」）について日韓で領土問題が起きている。
sen.e: There is a territorial dispute between Japan and South Korea over Takeshima Island (Shimane Prefecture) (Korean name is Dokdo Island), located in southwest under the occupation of the Republic of Korea.

There is a territorial dispute between Japan and South Korea over Takeshima Island (Shimane Prefecture) (Korean name is Dokdo Island), located in southwest under the occupation of the Republic of Korea.

There is a territorial dispute between Japan and South Korea over Takeshima Island (Shimane Prefecture) (Korean name is Dokdo Island), located in southwest under the occupation of the Republic of Korea.
